# Angular questions

Q1. Is angular a framework? Why?
A1. Yes is a framework. Because it gives you a big structure to order your whole architecture, it gives you a predefined system that demands a certain way of doing things.

Q2. What does “banana in a box” refers to?
A2. It’s a common way to called this sign, which is used for two way data binding: [( )]

Q3. True or false?: Angular changes the data we see by directly changing the HTML.
A3. False. Angular changes the view but through the DOM.

Q4. All HTML syntax is valid in Angular, except for one exception. What it is?
A4. The <script> tag.

Q5. A template expression is what goes…
A5. inside brackets .

Q6. Angular and AngularJS are the names of which versions?
A6. AngularJS is the version 1, Angular is the name for versions 2 and higher.

Q7. Angular is based on which language?
A7. Angular is based on TypeScript, a superset of JavaScript that compiles to clean JavaScript output.

Q8. Angular creators purposely skipped a number for a version and jumped to +2 number to avoid a confusion due to the misalignment of the router package’s version, which was already distributed. So the Angular version that doesn’t exist is...
A8. Angular 3.

Q9. How do you get only one-way binding in Angular?
A9. With [ ].

Q10. Can you use ng-repeat in Angular?
A10. No, ng-repeat is used in AngularJS, in Angular is ngFor.

Q11. What are structural directives use for?
A11. To manipulate the DOM

Q12. True or false: To pass data from parent to children you can use output()
A12. False. You should use @input( ).

Q13. How can you call an HTML tag to use it in a variable?
A13. With # .

Q14. In the next example, what does E do?

.directive('itemWidget', [function() {
	return{
		templateUrl:'saleItem.html',
		restrict:'E'
	}
}]);

A14. It restricts the directive to be used as an Element.

Q15. True or false: anything wrote with the asterisk syntax is the final form in the DOM.
A15. False. The asterisk syntax is not actually rendered, it doesn't end up in the DOM.

Q16. NgSwitch is a set of which directives?
A16. NgSwitch, NgSwitchCase, NgSwitchDefault

Q17. Can we combine restrict keys?
A17. Yes we can

Q18. Angular expressions can be written inside something regular JavaScript expressions can't. Where's that?
A18. AngularJS expressions can be written inside HTML.

Q19. What is ng-bind and where we can't use it?
A19. ng-bind is 2 way binding in AngularJS, it doesn't exist in Angular 2 and further.

Q20. What does the restrict key "M" do to a directive?
A20. It specifies that the directive can be use as a HTML comment.

Q21. Would this Angular CLI command create a new component?
ng generate new component my-new-component A21. No. The correct command to do that is ng generate component my-new-component

Q22. What does AsyncPipe do?
The AsyncPipe subscribes to an observable or promise and returns the latest value it has emitted.

Q23. How will Angular read a script tag inside a template?
A23. Angular would read it as unsafe and sanitizes it, which means it would delete the <script> but it will keep the safe part like the text content.

Q24. Which Anguar CLI command is used for running the project?
A24. ng serve

Q25. Double courly brackets is the special syntax used to write what?
A25. An interpolation.

Q26. Event binding consist on data flowing in which direction?
A26. From the DOM to the component.

Q27. Is alterEgo an optional field?
A27. Yes, is optional.

Q28. What information .ng-dirty give us?
A28. It tells that a form has been modified by the user.

Q29. In a dependency injection, which element asks dependencies for external sources?
A29. A class.

Q30. What are decorators for?
A30. To attach metadata to a class, property, method or parameter.
